question: Alex has 3 tubes of orange paint and 19 tubes of yellow paint. Carl has one third as many tubes of orange paint as Alex, and three times as many tubes of yellow paint as Alex. How many tubes of paint does Carl have?
answer:
Carl has 3*1/3= <<3*1/3=1>>1 tubes of orange paint
Carl has 19*3=<<19*3=57>>57 tubes of yellow paint
Carl has a total of 1+57 =<<1+57=58>>58 tubes of paint
#### 58
